column5: Fishing with my sister 8 pm Sat night on NE Pigeon Lake.  2 Game Wardens come over and do their thing.  No fish, I had my licence but my sister left her's at the cottage.  No problem, "good evening"  I was surprised  they were on patrol on a Saturday night.  Glad they were.  First time I've seen them in the area in the 3 yrs we've been up there.  Drove a fairly new Crestliner, about 17 ft, and Yammy 130 hp  Last time I was checked was 5 yrs ago on Nippissing.  Same combo then as well,  Crestliner/Yammy
good to see, last time I was stopped by a warden was 15 years ago at the dam in Omemee.   I wish I was stopped a few times a year

Got checked this summer at my crappie spot in Bobcaygeon. First time ever in the 15+ years I have fished up there.  Lake Simcoe's MNR  seems to be getting more vigilant though. I was checked 3 different times last winter in 3 different locations. I get checked at least once every winter on Simcoe.  Always happy to see them. Just wish it happened more.
I've been fishing the Kawarthas for close to 60 years and can HONESTLY say, I've been stopped by a Game Warden exactly ONE time....and I think that's pretty sad.
I haven't been checked for years on the kawartha's by a CO. Been stopped by OPP a couple times, but never a CO.  I'm surprised your sister didn't get a ticket for not having her license....lucky.  S.

I've been stopped 3 times up there the last 6-7 years, only once in my boat. In the boat it happened midweek on a lesser popular lake and I was the only guy out there besides the CO's but they stuck it out for hours on the lake, watched me with binoculars on occasion and eventually came over to check things out. Seemed to me like there would of been better things to do all morning, they coulda hit 5 lakes with all the time they spent there.  The other times were in a parking lot and once at an intersection on 36. Same CO every time, he was pretty cool with everything. Wish they were out more at the right times.
i got checked on rice lake last year, and again this year at the trout opener
I know Fire fighters don't like to be called anything but...I bet Conservation Officers like to be called by their proper name.
Before we moved here have been checked once in 20 years for OOS Bass from Nanticoke Hydro outflow. The last 5 yrs have had 6 safety checks. No problem.
Checked twice this year already.   Good conversation and good guys.  Even gave me a few spots.
I know Fire fighters don't like to be called anything but...  We used to be called firemen till that became politically un-correct.  If ya know what I mean Dax

I've been fishing the Kawarthas for close to 60 years and can HONESTLY say, I've been stopped by a Game Warden exactly ONE time....and I think that's pretty sad. wow! I'm on first name terms with a few of our guys up here, and see them a few times a year on the lake at least and probably half a dozen times in walmart and one guy five days a week when we greet as he drives past me at my son's school bus stop every morning.

Sister was lucky.  Been checked four times on Kesagami ice fishing, once on the Moose River, once half way to Fort Albany, outside Kirkland Lake at Kenogami, on the Big Rideau and on the Ganaraska,  Nine times in nine years.  Simon... it's definitely different up your way.
I was checked on Pigeon while ice fishing a few years ago. He lives right near Gannons Narrows. Was checked more often back in the 90's. Think the CO back then was Bill Fisher.
Just got back from the Sutton River last night, shockingly I was checked by a CO on Hawley Lake just south of Hudson's Bay. They landed on the lake and waved us over.
I just might have a tracking chip under your skin Mike. Their always watching the Solopaddler.
Remember that flu shot you got? Just sayin'...

I been buying a license for over 30 yrs and have never been checked either.  Grew up just outside Deep River, lived down in Oshawa for 20 yrs and regularly trekked up to Emily PP to camp and fish on Pigeon there, now back up here in North Bay.  I did see a CO checking other people at the loading ramp at Lavase River last year though when was just sitting in the truck with the wife.  Been the same with hunting season, not once. Same goes for that Boating license we needed to get..never been stopped by OPP on the water for it, that particular thing bugs me...money grab IMO.
never EVER been checked before.......................................then again im 14 LOL
Lol never been checked in my 27 years of life.

Never in any of the boats I have had,but once two winters ago.I see the police randomly stopping  boats quite frequently. Friend of mine has been checkked three times this summer alone in the same area.Same guys lol.
